title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 02 October 2014 - XWiki

09:45 <vmassol> first BFD done )  
09:45 <vmassol> :)  
09:45 <Enygma`> that was fast :P  
09:46 <vmassol> yeah I chose a topic I knew about :)  
09:58 <vmassol> and second one! (was an easy one) ;) Denis1 should have taken it actually, too bad for him!  
09:59 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
10:01 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
10:02 <Enygma`> ;0  
10:02 <Enygma`> :)  
10:08 <DarkKnightCZ> gdelhumeau: hi, should i create jira issue about that form thing?  
10:14 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
10:17 <polx> has quit  
10:20 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <gdelhumeau> DarkKnightCZ: hi. I think you can, but I'm not sure we will treat it in priority, since it only happens when we change the templates :/  
10:21 <gdelhumeau> \*we will not  
10:37 <vmassol> and 3!  
10:37 <vmassol> err 4  
10:38 <DarkKnightCZ> gdelhumeau: yup  
10:58 <vmassol> mflorea: there's no displayer for the Page property type?  
10:58 <mflorea> right  
10:58 <vmassol> oh too bad  
10:59 <vmassol> I was expecting some nice display :)  
10:59 <vmassol> I entered xwiki:Main.WebHome and got just that when displayed  
11:00 <vmassol> are there any restrictions (like vlaidation) or is it just a string?  
11:00 <vmassol> I was wondering if it was meant to be a strict document reference or if it was also meant to enter a url using the "doc:" or "url:" prefixes  
11:01 <vmassol> ?  
11:01 <vmassol> I guess just doc name as otherwise it would be called Link Type  
11:01 <vmassol> s/name/ref  
11:04 <tmortagne> vmassol: according to PageClass it's "page references" so I guess document references  
11:04 <vmassol> ok thanks, created http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11158  
11:05 <tmortagne> there is lots of new property type that should be added  
11:05 <tmortagne> we should probably brainstorm a list at some point  
11:05 <vmassol> a list of missing types?  
11:05 <vmassol> ah yes  
11:05 <vmassol> sorry missed the first message  
11:05 <vmassol> yes indeed  
11:06 <tmortagne> (and ideally specialized displayer for them)  
11:26 <AFKGeek> has joined #xwiki  
11:33 <gdelhumeau> Guys, I need to break the WikiUserManager API that is still considered unbstable  
11:34 <gdelhumeau> any objection?  
11:34 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: impossible to go trough deprecation ?  
11:35 <gdelhumeau> I would like to add new methods and deprecate some others  
11:35 <tmortagne> so by breaking the API you mean add new methods right ?  
11:36 <gdelhumeau> actually it was a silly idea to represent users by their string id -\_-  
11:36 <gdelhumeau> yes tmortagne  
11:36 <tmortagne> ok for me  
11:36 <tmortagne> well it depends  
11:37 <tmortagne> if we want at some point users to come from more sources than pages that make sense  
11:37 <tmortagne> but yes since we internally manipulate them as DocumenrReference a lot internally it does not make the API very easy to use  
11:38 <tmortagne> ideally we could need UserReference but that proposal have a hard time being validated  
11:38 <tmortagne> anyway ok for me as I said  
11:39 <gdelhumeau> Actually I have my current user who is "xwiki:XWiki.Admin"  
11:39 <gdelhumeau> and the ownerId of a subwiki which is "XWiki.Admin"  
11:39 <gdelhumeau> so it does not realize that it is the same person  
11:40 <gdelhumeau> or  
11:40 <tmortagne> well it should  
11:40 <tmortagne> that means it's not properly resolved  
11:40 <gdelhumeau> I fix the wiki user module to always return full id  
11:40 <gdelhumeau> which shoud be so much better  
11:40 <tmortagne> returning full id is a must yes anyway  
11:41 <tmortagne> (which is basically what you would do with DocumentReference based API anyway)  
12:31 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:44 <evalica> has quit  
12:48 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:49 <woshilapin> has quit  
13:00 <evalica> has quit  
13:09 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
13:44 <cjd> gdelhumeau: was there a wysiwyg/insert-table bug fixed recently w/ flamingo?  
13:44 <cjd> (table just looks weird)  
13:44 <gdelhumeau> nit as I know  
13:44 <gdelhumeau> \*not  
13:45 <cjd> http://i.imgur.com/uZJ4leQ.png  
13:45 <cjd> insert table -> 2x2  
13:46 <gdelhumeau> In FLamingo, the table has the width set to 100%  
13:46 <cjd> ok so it's expected behavior  
13:49 <vmassol> cjd: can you remind me why we cannot have the  attachment FS store by default? I'm asking since I know lots of projects in prodcution that are using it  
13:49 <vmassol> I know there's an existing issue about it but it seems to be a small since all those projects are using it in production. WDYT?  
13:50 <cjd> no problem with using it default IMO  
13:50 <cjd> there is the issue of deleted attachments not showing up in the tab  
13:51 <cjd> and if we make it default, we should remove the deleted attachments tab at the same time  
13:51 <cjd> as far as stability and stuff, it all seems to be fine  
13:52 <cjd> kind of off-topic, deleting a document with FS attachments does the wrong thing because oldcore does an XML export of the document (with versions and attachments) and stuffs \*that\* into the database :(  
13:52 <cjd> "wrong thing" --> uses a ton of memory anyway  
13:54 <vmassol> k I'll try to move forward with FS as default for attachments, will check past emails on the topic and resend something if need be  
13:54 <vmassol> thanks  
14:03 <Slashman> has quit  
14:04 <gdelhumeau> cjd: do you have an idea about http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11159 ?  
14:05 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
14:08 <cjd> have you been able to reproduce it?  
14:09 <sdumitriu> has quit  
14:10 <cjd> "On a page with an heavy content, I encounter the following JS error:" <-- looks like it's taking >10 seconds to load resources  
14:10 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
14:10 <gdelhumeau> I did not reproduce  
14:11 <gdelhumeau> Denis told me that his wiki was very very long  
14:11 <gdelhumeau> \*slow  
14:12 <cjd> so the idea is to increase the timeout so that a wiki which is dieing will still work?  
14:12 <Denis> I do not think so  
14:12 <Denis> the annoying aspect of it, it is to be just silent  
14:13 <Denis> when the timeout expire, you are left with a broken UI  
14:13 <Denis> what we need is some alert to the user to encourage reload  
14:17 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
14:17 <cjd> mmm 1. increase timeout (in config)   2. window.onerror = function (err) { if (err === requirejs timeout) { .. whatever ... } /\* wow that was ugly, I'm going to take a shower now \*/ }  
14:17 <cjd> 3. patch requirejs  
14:19 <Denis> increasing timeout is not a solution, it could still timeout  
14:20 <Denis> capturing the error and shading the page with a message and a big reload button would be good  
14:21 <cjd> increase the timeout long enough and the rest of the page will timeout first (in the browser)  
14:22 <cjd> say... 10 minutes :)  
14:35 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
14:37 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
14:46 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
14:47 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
14:48 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
15:07 <vmassol> wow we have a big bug in the LT code….  
15:08 <vmassol> thought it was fixed a long time ago but apparently not  
15:08 <vmassol> maybe there's been some regressions  
15:08 <vmassol> basically if any value you get has a meaning in wiki syntax it's going to be evluated  
15:09 <msmeria> has quit  
15:09 <vmassol> I wsa pretty sure I had put wiki=false somewehre in the past  
15:09 <vmassol> to fix this  
15:09 <cjd> LT code?  
15:09 <vmassol> livetable  
15:10 <cjd> ahh ok  
15:11 <tmortagne> vmassol: custom LT or standard LT ?  
15:11 <vmassol> standard  
15:11 <tmortagne> talking about the source  
15:13 <tmortagne> the standard LT source use wiki=false to not have this issue and that's what custom sources are supposed to do too, I checking and wiki=false is still there  
15:13 <tmortagne> in LiveTableResults.xml  
15:14 <vmassol> hmm indeed checking something  
15:14 <tmortagne> s/checking/checked/  
15:14 <cjd> {{html wiki=false}} ?  
15:14 <tmortagne> velocity  
15:14 <tmortagne> in html macro it's already wiki=false by default  
15:15 <tmortagne> the source produce JSO?  
15:15 <tmortagne> JSON  
15:15 <cjd> yeah, I thought so  
15:15 <tmortagne> not html  
15:15 <cjd> ahh I see  
15:15 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
15:15 <cjd> I should probably close that html macro for the benefit of the bot  
15:15 <cjd> <script>alert('hi');</script> {{/html}}  
15:16 <vmassol> found the problem  
15:16 <vmassol> thanks tmortagne  
15:16 <vmassol> that helped :)  
15:16 <tmortagne> cjd: it's not going to do much, the archive is displayed in a {{code}} macro :)  
15:17 <cjd> {{/code}}{{html clean="false"}}<script>alert('hi');</script> {{/html}}{{code language="none"}} ?  
15:17 <tmortagne> hmm i used to, looks different now  
15:17 <tmortagne> not sure what the displayed is doing  
15:17 <tmortagne> probably still code macro  
15:19 <tmortagne> cjd: yep closing the code macro should do it, just checked the displayer  
15:20 <tmortagne> actually it's breaking the code macro but no alert  
15:20 <tmortagne> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/IRC/xwikiArchive20141002  
15:20 <tmortagne> of course  
15:20 <tmortagne> it's not html  
15:20 <tmortagne> hmm no  
15:21 <tmortagne> looks like {{/code}} did not really closed he macro for some reason  
15:22 <cjd> I think the displayer escapes it  
15:22 <tmortagne> no  
15:22 <tmortagne> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/IRC/IRCBotArchiveSheet  
15:22 <tmortagne> the displayed does not do much  
15:23 <cjd> heh wat  
15:23 <tmortagne> checking something  
15:24 <tmortagne> aha I know  
15:24 <tmortagne> this is because of the line just before yours  
15:24 <cjd> wat  
15:24 <tmortagne> it's opens a submacro and you close it  
15:24 <tmortagne> s/it's/it/  
15:25 <tmortagne> macro parser use a stack  
15:25 <tmortagne> it does not stop at first {{/ it stop at first {{/ not consumed by a previous opening  
15:25 <tmortagne> so it's just luck  
15:25 <cjd> ~{{/code}}{{html clean="false"}}<marquee>They see me trollin, they hatin....</marquee>{{/html}}{{code language="irc"}}  
15:26 <tmortagne> yep this time it's working (and you made the rest of the page inline)  
15:26 <cjd> hah  
15:26 <cjd> oops  
15:39 <vmassol> we're barely keeping up with bugs for the past 2 weeks, see weeks 39 and 40 on http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=10000#Created-vs-Resolved-Chart/10470 at bottom  
15:39 <vmassol> so we'll need to continue BFD for quite a while IMO
